1.title: Kytara
1.plot: Stepán applies for a job as a night receptionist and immediately becomes a cover for fishy scheming.

2.title: Transformace
2.plot: Manager Tereza dusts off her desire to get a fourth star for the hotel. Wheelchaired Benál is lodged in the hotel, who becomes the target of great wrongs.

3.title: Zlatý dul
3.plot: Stepán is given a mysterious notebook by director Theodor, so called gold mine. The notebook holds contacts, which may make the job of a receptionist really lucrative.

4.title: Nina
4.plot: The world-known alternative choreographer Nina is lodged in the hotel, which makes Pavlínka the receptionist astounded.

5.title: Uran
5.plot: Jirina the barmaid replies to a dating advertisement. The rest of the hotel staff is with her during the blind date preparations.

6.title: Zítra tocím v Asi
6.plot: Porno is being filmed in the hotel, but the actors get sick. Which of the hotel employees will stand in?

7.title: Zásek
7.plot: Sparta plays with Celtic and the hotel is full of Scotish soccer fans.

8.title: Vyhazov
8.plot: The reception clerk Frantisek plans his thieving opus magnum. He decides to pick the hotel freezer clean and sell the meat to the Vietnamese.

9.title: Zázrak
9.plot: Stepán's mother is going to visit Prague, interested in whether her son's finally got a steady relationship.

10.title: Ochránce smecky
10.plot: The son of the barmaid Jirina is being bullied in school, so Jirina asks the janitor David to give the boy a lesson in self-defense.

11.title: Hodina H.
11.plot: Young Wu, son of the Chinese owners of the hotel, comes to the hotel. The ill-mannered under-aged brat has come to Prague to live an initiating erotic adventure.

12.title: Trináct sirotku
12.plot: The director Theodor will have to play the most important game of mahjong he's ever played.

imdb.plot outline: Stepán (Václav Neuzil) got a job as a second night receptionist in a three star Hotel Meteor on the periphery of Prague. He'd like to get along with the colleagues and not attract the attention of his superiors. But how is he supposed to do that, when he desperately falls in love with Pavlínka (Martha Issová), who works as a day receptionist? The see each other only in the moment when the shifts change! On top of that, Pavlínka is not interested in Stepán but in the aggressive hotel maintenance man David (David Novotný). He is in turn interested in two things only: how has his beloved Sparta played and how to avoid the exhausting erotic interest of his superior, the ambitious hotel manager Tereza (Lenka Krobotová). Tereza does her best to improve the quality of the hotel and get the long-wished-for fourth star. This concern clashes with the selfishness, indolence, laziness, acquisitiveness and cunning of the subordinates. Of all the hotel employees, the fourth star is of the least interest to her ex-husband Theodor (Martin Mysicka), the director of the hotel. His only interest is to perfect his skills in playing the Chinese game of mahjong. Tereza's efforts are being thwarted by the personal interests of other subordinates, too: the ambitious and treacherous cook Smutný (Jaroslav Plesl) craves the position of the chef, the melancholic chef Tichý (Miroslav Krobot) struggles with losing his taste as a result of work accident, the day receptionist Frantisek (Ivan Trojan) deals with the underworld and consorts with the dangerous criminal Major ('Pavel Simcik'), the hotel prostitute Libuska (Klára Melísková) trains a junior lacrosse team, the hotel taxi driver Jindra (Marek Taclík) is a gay with a strong maternal instinct and Jirina the barmaid (Simona Babcáková) has a deficit. In the course of series' season we watch in suspense whether the hotel manages - despite the clash of the employees' personal interests - to get the fourth star in the end, and the more refined and solvent clientèle with it. And is something like that even in the interest of the mysterious Chinese hotel owner?
